rows.ANTI-GOALS: What we're explicitly NOT trying to do - as important as goals
WHY ANTI-GOALS MATTER
Knowing what you won't do prevents drift, distraction, and doing things for wrong reasons.
WE ARE NOT TRYING TO:
❌ Build a venture-scale company
We're not optimizing for a $1B exit. $10-50M outcome is great.
Why: Prevents taking bad money, hiring too fast, growth-at-all-costs
❌ Be the cheapest option
We're premium-but-accessible, not Walmart.
Why: Prevents race to bottom on price
❌ Launch many SKUs quickly
We'll do 1 SKU really well before expanding.
Why: Prevents distraction, inventory complexity
❌ Compete on influencer spend
We won't pay $50K for a celebrity post.
Why: Prevents CAC inflation, unsustainable economics
❌ Build a big team
Target: <5 people at $100K MRR.
Why: Prevents overhead, keeps margins high
❌ Win on features/formulation
78 minerals is enough. We don't need 100 or added vitamins.
Why: Prevents R&D creep, manufacturing complexity
❌ Be everywhere
D2C first. Retail only if it makes sense later.
Why: Prevents channel distraction, margin compression
❌ Move fast and break things
We move deliberately. Quality > speed.
Why: Prevents compliance issues, brand damage
TEMPTATIONS TO RESIST
• When someone says 'you should be on Amazon' - maybe, but not yet
• When a big influencer wants $20K - probably not worth it
• When we could launch a new flavor - only after hitting $50K MRR
• When someone offers investment - only if we actually need it
• When competitors do something - doesn't mean we should
